pageContext.claim: “He did it a number of times -- when President Obama drew the red line in the sand. And then he should have crossed that red line, because some horrible acts against humanity took place, including gas and the killing through gases.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump now criticizes Obama for failing to follow up on his warning to Syria that using chemical weapons would cross a red line that would merit a response by the United States. But he ignores his own history on the issue. In September, 2013, when Obama was considering air strikes against Syria over alleged use of chemical weapons, Trump tweeted that it would be a huge mistake that would lead to "very bad things." He urged: "President Obama, do not attack Syria."
